Interface Board

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleBoard
public interface Board
Interface for a game board model. It defines brick movement, collision detection, state updates, scoring, and level management.

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      boolean moveBrickDown()
      Moves brick down when no collision with the floor or other fixed blocks.
      Returns:
      true if the brick moved down successfully else false

    • moveBrickLeft

      boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Moves brick left by one unit.
      Returns:
      true if the brick moved left successfully else false

    • moveBrickRight

      boolean moveBrickRight()
      Moves brick right by one unit.
      Returns:
      true if the brick moved left successfully else false

    • rotateLeftBrick

      boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Moves brick left by one unit.
      Returns:
      true if the brick moved left successfully else false

    • hardDrop

      void hardDrop()
      Handles hard drop.

    • createNewBrick

      boolean createNewBrick()
      Creates and initialize a new brick.
      Returns:
      true if the new brick immediately conflicts with bricks, else false

    • getBoardMatrix

      int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Gets the current state of the game board matrix.
      Returns:
      2D array which represents the game board

    • getViewData

      ViewData getViewData()
      Gets data to render the current game.
      Returns:
      a ViewData object

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merge the current brick into game board matrix when the brick lands.

    • clearRows

      ClearRow clearRows()
      Checks completed rows in game matrix. If there is completed rows then clear all the rows.
      Returns:
      a ClearRow object containing the number of removed rows, the new matrix, and the score bonus

    • getScore

      Score getScore()
      Gets current game score.
      Returns:
      a Score object

    • newGame

      void newGame()
      Resets game matrix to start a new game.

    • getLevel

      Level getLevel()
      Gets the current level object.
      Returns:
      a Level object

    • nextGame

      void nextGame()
      Resets game matrix to advance level.
